name: Protector (theNumberSeven)
description:
*If components of the game/UI look like they're in strange positions try adjusting the zoom level of your browser. This is a quirk with Unity's UI system that I didn't get around to fixing*

Press D, F, J,  and K to toggle the respective bumper on/off

Each time you bounce a ball off a bumper you get 1 point

A new ball will be added at 10 points, then 1 more every 30 points

Balls get faster (up to a cap) each time they bounce off something

Leaving bumpers on consumes power, if you run out of power all bumpers will be disabled until the power reaches the first yellow line, then all bumpers become usable again.

If a ball gets past the bumpers you will lose 50% of your power. If this brings you below 0% power then you will lose.

I wanted to do much more with this polish/fx-wise but I'm exhausted and am going to sleep. This is my submission for ScoreSpace Jam #17.
